games.catastrophe

Class AI

  • java.lang.Object
    • joueur.BaseAI
      • games.catastrophe.AI

  • public class AI
extends joueur.BaseAI
    This is where you build your AI for the Catastrophe game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Game game
      This is the Game object itself, it contains all the information about the current game
      Player player
      This is your AI's player.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AI() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ended(boolean won, java.lang.String reason)
      This is automatically called when the game ends.
      void gameUpdated()
      This is automatically called every time the game (or anything in it) updates.
      java.lang.String getName()
      This returns your AI's name to the game server.
      java.lang.String getSetting(java.lang.String key)
      Gets an AI setting passed to the program via the `--aiSettings` flag.
      boolean runTurn()
      This is called every time it is this AI.player's turn.
      void start()
      This is automatically called when the game first starts, once the Game object and all GameObjects have been initialized, but before any players do anything.

        doOrder, invalid, setSettings

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Field Detail

      • game

        public Game game
        This is the Game object itself, it contains all the information about the current game

      • player

        public Player player
        This is your AI's player. This AI class is not a player, but it should command this Player.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AI

        public AI()

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        This returns your AI's name to the game server. Just replace the string.
        Overrides:
        getName in class joueur.BaseAI
        Returns:
        string of you AI's name

      • start

        public void start()
        This is automatically called when the game first starts, once the Game object and all GameObjects have been initialized, but before any players do anything. This is a good place to initialize any variables you add to your AI, or start tracking game objects.
        Overrides:
        start in class joueur.BaseAI

      • gameUpdated

        public void gameUpdated()
        This is automatically called every time the game (or anything in it) updates. If a function you call triggers an update this will be called before that function returns.
        Overrides:
        gameUpdated in class joueur.BaseAI

      • ended

        public void ended(boolean won,
                  java.lang.String reason)
        This is automatically called when the game ends. You can do any cleanup of you AI here, or do custom logging. After this function returns the application will close.
        Overrides:
        ended in class joueur.BaseAI
        Parameters:
        won - true if your player won, false otherwise
        name - reason">a string explaining why you won or lost

      • runTurn

        public boolean runTurn()
        This is called every time it is this AI.player's turn.
        Returns:
        Represents if you want to end your turn. True means end your turn, False means to keep your turn going and re-call this function.

      • getSetting

        public java.lang.String getSetting(java.lang.String key)
        Gets an AI setting passed to the program via the `--aiSettings` flag. If the flag was set it will be returned as a string value, null otherwise.
        Overrides:
        getSetting in class joueur.BaseAI
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the setting you wish to get the value for
        Returns:
        A string representing the value set via command line, or null if the key was not set
